latestAction.text: Cloture motion on the motion to proceed to the measure rendered moot in Senate.

item.title: Transportation, Housing and Urban Development, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2024

latestAction.text: POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - Pursuant to clause 1(c) of rule XIX, the Chair announced further proceedings on H.R. 4820 would be postponed.

item.title: Department of the Interior, Environment, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2024

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 239.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 213 - 203 (Roll no. 566). (text: CR H5235)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 213 - 203 (Roll no. 566). (text: CR H5235)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 213 - 200 (Roll no. 565).
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H5241-5242)

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 838, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 838.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H5235-5241)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 46.

The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 4821 and H.R. 4820 under a structured rule with one hour of general debate for each bill. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 6126, under a closed rule, with one hour of general debate. Each measure has one motion to recommit.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 118-261, by Mrs. Fischbach.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 118-261, by Mrs. Fischbach.

cdata.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4821) making appropriations for the Department of the Interior, environment, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4820) making appropriations for the Departments of Transportation, and Housing and Urban Development, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 6126) making emergency supplemental appropriations to respond to the attacks in Israel for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024.

This resolution sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4821) making appropriations for the Department of the Interior, environment, and related agencies for FY2024, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4820) making appropriations for the Departments of Transportation, and Housing and Urban Development, and related agencies for FY2024, and for other purposes; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 6126) making emergency supplemental appropriations to respond to the attacks in Israel for FY2024.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4821) making appropriations for the Department of the Interior, environment, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4820) making appropriations for the Departments of Transportation, and Housing and Urban Development, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 6126) making emergency supplemental appropriations to respond to the attacks in Israel for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
